programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon have high hopes when they return to the site of one of their greatest triumphs, while the other bidders take on the self-proclaimed king of storage.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a torch from the 1984 Olympics, the world's smallest pistol and a 1937 car that may once have belonged to gangster Bugsy Siegel.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick risks buying a painting supposedly by Renaissance artist Albrecht Durer, but then has to ascertain if it is genuine. He also judges the value of a motorcycle.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick salvages a film projector that is more than 100 years old and two 1950s petrol-station showpieces.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick offers to repair a vintage mechanical bull, and also restores a 1940s soft drinks machine.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A furious storm causes havoc on the highway. Plus, Jamie takes a call that turns into the most challenging recovery his heavy rescue team has had to make all season.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: Featuring a human flying machine, a sword swallower and a man with stretchy skin. Plus, exploring whether a snake handler can be immune to the venom of a deadly black mamba.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Investigators question a ship full of suspects when a naval officer is poisoned at sea, in an attempt to work out which of the many theories surrounding his death is true.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: George Percy and Sheldon Nichols strip a Land Rover 90 while Frankie Oatway and Ben Szymanski pin their hopes on a Mitsubishi Pajero. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and his father clash when Les's idea turns dangerous, and Ashley embarks on a new in-house business venture.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff fight over whether they should buy a batch of venomous reptiles, and an incident forces Les to seek a new head of security.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a crumbling building full of salvaged gems, but have a hard time getting the valuables out safely before the roof caves in.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Experts examine the many ancient Jewish and Christian documents that did not make it into the Bible, exploring why they were excluded.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates rumours of human-alien genetic experiments reportedly going on deep below the New Mexico desert in an underground base.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick salvages a film projector that is more than 100 years old and two 1950s petrol-station showpieces.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick offers to repair a vintage mechanical bull, and also restores a 1940s soft drinks machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is offered an alternating-current motor invented by 19th-century pioneer Nikola Tesla, and a pair of trainers used in Back to the Future.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars fight for memorabilia from undefeated boxing champ Rocky Marciano, and Rick takes a look at a one-of-a-kind glow-in-the-dark car.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon fight over a piece of movie history, and Rene plans to make the other bidders pay dearly for coming to his home town.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Up the Ante in El Monte
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod try to outwit their rivals at an auction in El Monte, but face disaster if their plan backfires.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and his father clash when Les's idea turns dangerous, and Ashley embarks on a new in-house business venture.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff fight over whether they should buy a batch of venomous reptiles, and an incident forces Les to seek a new head of security.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four new bladesmiths face the challenge of transforming the barrel of a gun into a knife, before two go on to forge an iconic Cavalry Saber.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Uncovering the cities and government fortresses covertly constructed beneath US soil, including an advanced network of drug-smuggling tunnels.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: A team travels to Germany and Poland to investigate a possible connection between the UFO phenomenon and the Third Reich.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Examining the accuracy of the four gospels of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, sacred texts which apparently contain information about the life of Jesus.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tells a frightening story of a hold-up at his grandfather's store, and a dominatrix brings her gear into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Members of the Gold family open the doors to their huge Detroit pawn shop once again as they encounter intriguing finds and awkward customers.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers return to Montebello, California, where Rene and Casey unsuccessfully try to throw off the competition. Ivy secures his skating equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey attempt to shut out Jarrod and Brandi, Darrell uncovers an interesting locker, while Ivy meets a furry friend. Reality series following people who make a living from bidding for the contents of abandoned storage units.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Odysea's single catch begins to place pressure on Jason, who realises his luck needs to change if he is to make any money.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate alleged sightings of UFOs during the Black Death, and examine the theory that aliens may have inflicted the disease on the human race.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts examine the possibility of a secret US government facility accused of creating many diseases and biological weapons.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Documentary considering whether the once seemingly far-fetched idea of the undead roaming the planet is actually closer to happening then previously thought possible.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon fight over a piece of movie history, and Rene plans to make the other bidders pay dearly for coming to his home town.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Up the Ante in El Monte
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod try to outwit their rivals at an auction in El Monte, but face disaster if their plan backfires.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists John Sessions, Mark Steel, Clive Anderson and Alan Davies answer questions on corks, cats and carbon dioxide, with host Stephen Fry awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian James Acaster, TV presenters Gabby Logan and Melvin Odoom and Cold Feet star Fay Ripley join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Countdown dictionary expert Susie Dent, comedian Bob Mortimer and TV presenters Ore Oduba and Stacey Solomon join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as Pointless co-presenter Richard Osman and comedians Romesh Ranganathan and Rachel Parris join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of picnics, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.sub-title: Find This Thing We Need To
programme.desc: Carol makes a big discovery, enlisting Tandy and Erica to help her track down some answers.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Tandy tries to take charge of a new situation that has unfolded in the group, and Carol is suspicious of Todd's behaviour.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle take downhill mountain-bike racing to the next level by adding more wheels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a collection of classic cars in Colorado, including a 1961 Messerschmitt, and decide to make an offer on a prize exhibit.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Kent.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees bidders battling to win potential treasures found in Yeovil's storage containers, lock-ups and garages. Linda has to work for her profit and tensions reach boiling point as Dan pushes Nat to her limits.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects. The guys unearth ultra-rare skis for a Model T Ford as they pick one of the biggest barns they've ever seen.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank makes a shrewd bid that leads to a big discovery and Mike falls hard for two century-old cars.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines how the car industry in Germany and Japan blossomed following the Second World War, becoming manufacturing giants that far outstripped the Allied nations that had defeated them. He test drives some of the vehicles Germany and Japan produced during the post-war period, as well as an assortment of other classic cars, including E-Types and Mustangs. He also reveals the sad tale of the Austin Allegro, a vehicle that had a devastating impact on the British car industry.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and David Baddiel travel along more than 1,200 miles of hazardous roads in Ethiopia on a journey to Aksum, the country's holiest place. However, they have to contend with more than fatigue and unreliable terrain to reach their destination, as they encounter drug-taking truck drivers, suffer a disastrous breakdown and start to run out of fuel at the worst possible time.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond debate which company has made the greatest number of exceptional vehicles, and James May finds a way of transporting caravans to campsites without inconveniencing other road users. The Top Gear track plays host to a replica of one of the world's most famous rally cars, and broadcaster Chris Evans - some five years before he was announced as the show's new presenter - is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Joel takes on an epic build and Peter travels to a historic gold rush town to build a mining shaft house that would make any prospector proud.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John and Dave get rid of unwanted skips and trailers, which are home to some unusual objects. Elsewhere, emergency repairs are required to get two police bikes back out on the road.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Renaultsport Twingo 133 through a stringent examination in Belfast - with a helping hand from actor Ross Kemp. Richard Hammond samples the delights of racing airport vehicles, and James May takes the Vauxhall Insignia VXR for a drive in the company of Margaret Calvert, whose ideas were central to the design of modern British road signs. Film director Guy Ritchie is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and there is also a group test of high-performance off-roaders from BMW, Audi and Range Rover.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Strongman Eddie meets - and eats - gators roaming the Everglades, tests his grappling skills with WWE legends The Headbangers, and tries to devour a kitchen sink full of ice-cream.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie visits the Garden State for supersized breakfast in a New Jersey diner, a tryout with ice hockey pros the NJ Devils - and an epic struggle with an eight-hot-dog challenge.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the Christmas fun are former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld, Witless star Kerry Howard, broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie. They all reveal amazing stories, but are they telling the truth, or making it all up?.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are snooker veteran Steve Davis, actor Craig Parkinson, comedian Sara Pascoe and Strictly co-host Claudia Winkleman. They all have amazing stories to share, but whether or not they are true or works of fiction remains to be seen.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists John Sessions, Mark Steel, Clive Anderson and Alan Davies answer questions on corks, cats and carbon dioxide, with host Stephen Fry awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Sara Pascoe, Stephen K Amos and Jason Manford join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of plants, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Dara O Briain, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Suzi Ruffell are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and a series of mischievous games, Dave invites three of the country's finest comic minds to help him make sense of our insensible world. In the first episode he is joined by Richard Osman, Phil Wang and Sara Barron, as they take a deep dive into the details we usually miss.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville places an ad in a lonely hearts magazine and finally meets the girl of his dreams. After stretching the truth about being a young executive with a flash sports car, his romance ends before it even begins. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian attempts to zigzag his way 1,200 miles through Kenya and Tanzania, beginning this leg of his journey on a vintage steam locomotive designed in Glasgow. On a cattle farm established by an aristocrat a century ago, he dons a pair of overalls and joins workers as they bathe more than 2,000 animals to ward off parasites and biting flies. Later, in the vast Tsavo East National Park, he bottle-feeds orphaned elephant calves, before visiting a Maasai village - where he quickly regrets a faux pas during a meat feast.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Following in Powell's footsteps in the stunning yet challenging north Arizona landscape, Snow and the crew take on the area's rapids in antique wooden boats as they learn about the region's geological and Native American past.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians help Hektor Rous, the son of 'Aussie Earl' Keith Rous, piece together the mysterious history of the family's Tudor country home in Suffolk. In 2004, he moved from Melbourne, Australia, hoping to rebuild the estate's fortunes, and established events such as the Latitude Festival in its 3,500-acre grounds.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his team head to an army training ground on Salisbury Plain to discover what lies beneath the Barrow Clump, a huge mound of earth built by Bronze Age people to bury their dead. More than 2,500 years later, the Anglo-Saxons re-used the location as a burial site, leaving behind some fascinating artefacts. The team is joined for the dig by a group of wounded soldiers whose members are being trained in archaeology as part of their rehabilitation.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: How a well-preserved Viking ship discovered in 1904 continues to present archaeologists with new mysteries to unravel.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The daring engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his team head to an army training ground on Salisbury Plain to discover what lies beneath the Barrow Clump, a huge mound of earth built by Bronze Age people to bury their dead. More than 2,500 years later, the Anglo-Saxons re-used the location as a burial site, leaving behind some fascinating artefacts. The team is joined for the dig by a group of wounded soldiers whose members are being trained in archaeology as part of their rehabilitation.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines creatures that spin and weave, contemplating the history of silk production and its romantic origins in China.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: An exploration of how invertebrates' production of silk 300 million years ago became their greatest invention. Stronger than a steel thread of the same diameter, the material is as pliable as elastic and employed by spiders for activities as diverse as courtship, catching prey and tending their young. David Attenborough reveals how some communal spiders create silken palaces rising 15m to 20m into the forest canopy.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of London's Shard, revealing how it was influenced by the Milan Metro, concrete grain storage in Minnesota and a lifting mechanism in the Venice shipyards.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: How a well-preserved Viking ship discovered in 1904 continues to present archaeologists with new mysteries to unravel.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the steam train reached the height of its importance in Europe just as fresh innovations were being made in America, with groundbreaking trains like the Burlington Zephyr.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville changes his image with the help of some trendy clothes and a medallion made from a cocoa tin lid, while Arkwright decides to increase his profits through advertising.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville places an ad in a lonely hearts magazine and finally meets the girl of his dreams. After stretching the truth about being a young executive with a flash sports car, his romance ends before it even begins. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. Nikki and Jack investigate when a man is run down and killed by a Tube train - although not long after, a female vicar is murdered on the Underground, leaving them with the difficult prospect of building a case against her distraught husband. However, when a young roofer is stalked and brutally killed on his journey home, CCTV cameras pick up a suspect who links the deaths, and a full-scale manhunt is launched. Meanwhile, Nikki forms a bond with one of the detectives, who asks her to help re-evaluate his father's murder when he was a child. Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh faces a dilemma when his friend Joey makes a dying wish, and the Knight family support Ajax and Meryl as they each confront a crisis.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh is shocked when he finds out Penny has accepted a job in the city, and the hospital is thrown into chaos.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: The Dirty War on the NHS
programme.desc: Documentary examining plans to sell off the National Health Service. The film explores the history of the world's first people's health service and how it has provided a vital safety net to generation of people, and examines efforts to introduce an insurance-based healthcare system, which in the US, has denied vital medical treatment to millions of people. Filmed in both countries, the film warns of danger to the fundamental human right to medical care.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: Detective Superintendent Elizabeth Bancroft is running an operation to against a vicious gang and adopts dubious methods to bring down the brothers who run it. Meanwhile, DS Katherine Stevens is assigned to a cold murder case and finds that there's more to it than it seems - and that Bancroft has some secrets in her past that may prove difficult to hide. Thriller, starring Sarah Parish, with Faye Marsay, Art Malik and Amara Khan.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team visit Llandudno, where James Layte seriously undervalues some cutlery, and a Chinese wall plaque sells for a huge profit at auction.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity has a plan to rile Cain, Liv worries about Aaron, while Jamie and Andrea resolve their conflict.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Roy makes an error of judgement by leaving Richard unattended, and Michelle receives a mystery offer for the Bistro. Elsewhere, Ryan begs Gary for work to pay off his debt.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, the comedian meets a Pyrenean mountain dog that has a problem with its bladder. Elsewhere, a dog suffering from skin problems needs surgery on its eyes, and Paul also helps a West Highland white terrier that is almost twice the weight it should be get into shape.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Nina lays the blame on Roy, and Michael waits in vain for a visit from Grace and Tianna. Elsewhere, Ryan completes a mission for Gary.

programme.title: Sticks and Stones
programme.desc: In the final episode, Thomas finally opens up to his boss Chris Carter about the bullying he has been subjected to. Carter is sceptical, but Thomas insists on the issue being dealt with that day. Later, the cause of the team's behaviour is laid bare. Starring Ken Nwosu, Susannah Fielding and Ben Miller.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Peston

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How toilet paper is produced from trees, the making of absinthe and how cricket balls are made tough enough to face test match batsmen.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a Renault Alpine 310 in France, but mechanic Edd China finds the car holds some surprises when he tries to fix it up.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: The comedian, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and guest captains James May and Andy Parsons, oversees a hotly contested pub quiz between The Pub from Essex and The Village from Merseyside.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A mansion in San Francisco is swallowed by a sinkhole, a chemical explosion occurs in America and two Russian jets collide at an air show. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Passengers are rescued from a plane crash in the Indian Ocean, a volcano threatens a town in Hawaii, and a helicopter pilot misjudges his moves at an air show.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: The team evades a floodwater surge by scrambling to higher ground, and with the future uncertain, Bobby struggles to keep the crew motivated.

programme.title: Overhaulin' Chronicles
programme.desc: Chip and the A-team design and overhaul Lanny Mann's '67 Ford Fairlane GTA.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The requirements that must be met to transform a family car into a rally car. Plus, the manufacture of titanium, the metal that the modern aerospace industry relies on.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Missing
programme.desc: Terry O'Quinn examines whether the tragic destruction of an Air France airliner in 2009 could ever happen again, and investigates deforestation in Siberian.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The king crab season arrives in Dutch Harbour, but the captains face the dilemma of whether to sail or stay in port after receiving a weather warning on their last night on land. Meanwhile, the sole survivor of the Big Valley, which went down 10 months earlier, discusses his experience.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The rookies suffer tension as a new partner leads them on a wild goose chase underground. Meanwhile, the Cooke Brothers' season gets off to a bad and dangerous start.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Russell Mcdonough has his work cut out when a track collapses under the weight of his rig, while troubles lie ahead for Yogi.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Smart city car the Fiat Panda is also a surprisingly good off-road hack. Mike Brewer tracks down a 4x4 model with potential, passing the vehicle on to mechanic Edd China, as the pair try to turn a profit improving its credentials before selling it on.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini goes to a sale in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, in a bid to purchase a range of Ford cars that were made between 1935 and 1940

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes a look at a customer's 1973 Daytona Spyder. Painted 'restoration red', it is not a look that will stand out at the Cavallino Classic, a prestigious Ferrari concours.

programme.title: Blowing Up History
programme.desc: Examining the lost city of Chichen Itza in Mexico, finding out how it was built and how human sacrifice helped to shape it.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Justin gambles thousands of dollars as he struggles over the season. Opal queen Kelly is in desperate need for a big find underground and Aaron and Greg's claim might pay off.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Cornelia Marie risks getting caught in a storm after blowing a head gasket and being forced to return to Dutch Harbour for repairs. Meanwhile, a wrist injury suffered by Captain Phil's son threatens to put an end to his season.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: With less than a week remaining, every crew is battling the clock, and just when they think it could not get any harder, a massive storm descends on Nome.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard examines furniture in a Black Country factory. Next, in Derby, a new contact pays off when he finds the crankshaft from a Battle of Britain fighter plane.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Experienced dirt-road driver Dennis Dent goes head to head with a lifelong enemy, while Christian Reynolds takes on the wild back country on a vital mission to build a bridge.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a Renault Alpine 310 in France, but mechanic Edd China finds the car holds some surprises when he tries to fix it up.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Rookies' relationship is on the rocks as they battle their biggest claim yet as well as each other. With two partners working at different speeds, there's a fight brewing.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard enjoys a rare chance to scour the wild items at Chester Zoo. Later in Leicestershire, he unearths a royal relic.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to an antiques shop in Edinburgh on a hunt for new stock, and on an expedition to a 750-year-old house, he discovers an item that takes him out of his comfort zone.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Bitesize
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard goes to a fair in the West Midlands where he finds a plethora of bargains. Plus, in Llangollen he visits a dealer who he has been buying from for three years..

programme.title: Carabao Cup on Quest
programme.desc: Action from the quarter-finals, featuring Everton v Leicester City, Oxford United v Manchester City, Manchester Untied v Colchester United and Aston Villa v Liverpool.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The hunt for the FALN terrorist group, who were suspected of setting off several bombs across America during the 1970s and 1980s.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How splinters of bone helped forensic investigators to trace a murderer four years after the victim first disappeared.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2015, Edward Lowry was found savagely beaten to death in South Dakota. With little evidence left behind, police had to piece together Ed's last moments from CCTV.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which a loving couple were gunned down and killed. A cryptic message found scrawled across the pair's bedroom wall led police to suspect the crime was drug related, though the victims had no obvious involvement in such an illegal trade.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The hunt for a killer who preyed on senior citizens in the town of River Parish, Louisiana, during the spring of 1997.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Emergency Animal Medical Technician Laura Hackett deals with one of the worst cases of cruelty she has ever seen when she rescues a dog that has been brutally attacked. It is close to death after being beaten and stabbed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown heads to the Halls Gap Zoo in Victoria, where Stephanie the lemur is suffering with an infection in her tooth that could become a major problem if not fixed.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Rebekah has made a remarkable recovery after being injured in the Boston Marathon bombing. Now, she is looking for the perfect dress for her wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Trisha's father helps her pick out a dress, while Caitlin has her fitting now that her dad is well enough to attend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride who grew up in a children's home had to share clothes with the other kids, so wants something very special for her own wedding dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown checks up on a shar pei, investigating whether the dog's sight has improved. Plus, a tiny terrier is savaged by a bigger dog and a police Alsatian has a mystery fever.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Australian vet Chris Brown performs potentially life-saving operations on a golden retriever with a broken back, and a puggle has his claws clipped. Meanwhile, a breeding mare gives birth to a foal, and a boxer dog suffers an acute allergic reaction.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team wades through thick mud to retrieve a wild boar, and rescues ostriches found abandoned without food.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators responds to reports of animal cruelty, rescuing pets and dealing with abusive owners.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: After a successful day of salvaging at the recycling centre in Altrincham, Greater Manchester, upcycling expert Sarah Moore tasks carpenter Norman Wilkinson with reimagining an old wall cabinet. While furniture designer Rupert Blanchard is hoping he can create a top end piece from a pair of metal bench ends, Sarah takes on the challenge of restyling a fashion mannequin.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into how the smallest pieces of evidence left at a crime scene, such as a fingerprint or a shoe, can be critical in solving a case.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Bobby and Sherilyn Jamison, who vanished along with their six-year-old daughter Madison in Oklahoma in October 2009. Detectives eventually uncovered a series of disconnected leads pointing to drugs, family dysfunction, and even supernatural beliefs.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Liz and John Calvert, who vanished in March 2008 from Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, where they ran a boating resort business. Shortly before they went missing some financial discrepancies were found in their bank accounts, and suspicion fell on their accountant Dennis Gerwing - who committed suicide a day after being named a person of interest in relation to their disappearance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Arguments ensue when Judea brings along her divorced parents, who have not seen each other for three years, and the bride struggles to keep the drama at bay.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Breast cancer survivor Sonja feels her fiance has already stuck with her for better or worse and should help choose her wedding dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Tammi has just 10 weeks until her wedding and is looking for a princess gown with Cinderella sleeves.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Professional dancer Karina is looking for a dress different to the costumes she usually wears in her shows, but loves every gown in sight and has trouble making a decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A consultant meets 18-year-old bride Kelsey, who arrives with plenty of drama over a broken promise about who would be her maid of honour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Michael and Chris have different visions for their wedding and tension soon rises between the pair as Lori tries to find some common ground.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer does not like being the centre of attention, while a bride makes a return visit to the shop with her far from supportive mother.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride spends $11,000 on a dress, then decides it needs some alterations, while another customer who has recently lost a lot of weight is excited to try on gowns.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard goes climbing at a 17th-century mansion in Cambridge, before he encounters a tough negotiator on a visit to a large salvage yard.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: After a successful day of salvaging at the recycling centre in Altrincham, Greater Manchester, upcycling expert Sarah Moore tasks carpenter Norman Wilkinson with reimagining an old wall cabinet. While furniture designer Rupert Blanchard is hoping he can create a top end piece from a pair of metal bench ends, Sarah takes on the challenge of restyling a fashion mannequin.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jeanne is concerned that she'll never get the weight-loss surgery that could save her life. An unexpected death halts her progress.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner team up to find out why a woman was separated from her birth family when she was two. The miraculous journey resolves many family mysteries.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: Ants in My Head: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: The story of 12-year-old Shreya Darji from India, who suffers an infestation which led to more than a thousand ants being removed from her ears, and 10 emerging every day.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Katie accepts an award in Dublin, tensions mount in her love life. With the prospect of bankruptcy looming, she recruits expert help to control her spending.
